intro: Phlomoides fimbriata, commonly known as the fringed phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. Its leaves are typically narrow and slightly hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Phlomoides fimbriata is often found in grasslands and rocky outcrops, thriving in well-drained soils.
